item.title: 100 Gbps Wavelength Service Open for Business
item.description:
While many businesses are enjoying the advantages of 100 Mbps Fast Ethernet, bandwidth capabilities are increasing exponentially. 100 Gbps wavelength service is now available on the West Coast, a thousandfold increase over standard 100 Mbps Ethernet. What necessitates such high bandwidth, and where can it be obtained? The factors driving the demand for 100 Gbps bandwidth are the same ones that make 100 Mbps nearly entry-level. Many smaller businesses struggle with their outdated T1 lines, which operate at a slow 1...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/100-gbps-wavelength-service-open-for-business/

item.title: Low Latency Fiber Routes To Europe and Asia
item.description:
Numerous American companies establish branches in the UK and Europe, while multinational corporations operate globally. A prevalent solution for connecting these international offices, including cloud services, is low-latency fiber optic routes. The term “low latency,” once obscure, gained prominence with the shift from traditional phone lines to VoIP. Previously, it primarily described delays in satellite communication. The question arises: why the emphasis on low-latency fiber routes now? Aren’t fiber connections inherently low latency?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/low-latency-fiber-routes-to-europe-and-asia/
